item.title: Bringing The Best Things for Your Sweetheart's Development
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]With Christmas behind us and a new year upon us, we are excited to have a little break all to ourselves. I love having these boys with me and spending some much needed time together. However, if you are like us, you start to find yourself going a bit stir crazy at times. Yes, the new Christmas toys are cool, but they are only cool for a limited time (unless you are Graham’s nook). I love that that boy loves to read!
You have to love your children unselfishly. That is hard. But it is the only way.
Davis is my whimsical three-year-old who loves to play, play, and play some more! He loves to use his imagination and create games. He also loves finger puppets. So, I decided I would make him a few of his own woodland animals. I free handed these so no judging on the artistry! I think they have a unique personality all their own if I do say so myself. Not to mention, their backsides even have personality. I left them black and white so that you and your kids could color them together and make them your own[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1038" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1037" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Just print off the pdf, color, cut and tape around the sides.  These are perfect for a rainy or snowy day.  Grab a mug of hot chocolate, prop your feet by the fire and watch their little imaginations run wild. I think next time I should create a printable woodland scene.  Next time maybe.  My time is precious few with these babies before I head back to work.  I’m soaking up the goodness. (Source: gogrowgo.com)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Grab a mug of hot chocolate, prop your feet by the fire and watch their little imaginations run wild. I think next time I should create a printable woodland scene. Next time maybe. My time is precious few with these babies before I head back to work. I’m soaking up the goodness.

item.title: Unforgettable Memories from a Thanksgiving Day in 1902
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]Thanksgiving is just around the corner. While it doesn’t usually get as much attention from kids as Christmas, it can still be a great holiday filled with lots of fun family memories. We’ve collected dour favorite thanksgiving activities and printables for kids all in one place so you can find them and choose your favorites to do with your family this Thanksgiving!
There can be no keener revelation of a society’s soul than the way in which it treats its children.
For a fun game on Thanskgiving day, print out this adorable turkey matching game. I love the cute little animated turkeys! I love the idea of taking the entire month of November to make this thankful tree. If you didn’t start in time, don’t worry, you can double up each day until Thanksgiving! Another countdown to Thanksgiving idea is this thankfulness chain. By the last day you’ll have a pretty decoration and lots of reasons to be thankful! Take a small nature hike and collect some pine cones to make this adorable turkey craft.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1048" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1036" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]These turkey treat bags would also make a great party favor for school or to give each of the kids who attended the family gathering! If you want a fun activity to keep kids busy while they wait for the meal on the big day, this is a fun printable Thanksgiving word search. You could also print out a few of these Thanksgiving coloring sheets for each of the kids. For older kids, or adults print out a few copies of this intricate turkey coloring page. It’s gorgeous!!! (Source: beautythroughimperfection.com)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Our website address is: http://dev.joomexp.com/wordpress/melokids.

What personal data we collect and why we collect it

Comments

When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Contact forms

Cookies

If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you have an account and you log in to this site, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Analytics

Who we share your data with

How long we retain your data

If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where we send your data

Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

Your contact information

Additional information

How we protect your data

What data breach procedures we have in place

What third parties we receive data from

What automated decision making and/or profiling we do with user data

Industry regulatory disclosure requirements

item.title: Endlessly Creative Ways to Tell Your Kids You Love Them
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]With Christmas behind us and a new year upon us, we are excited to have a little break all to ourselves. I love having these boys with me and spending some much needed time together. However, if you are like us, you start to find yourself going a bit stir crazy at times. Yes, the new Christmas toys are cool, but they are only cool for a limited time (unless you are Graham’s nook). I love that that boy loves to read!
You have to love your children unselfishly. That is hard. But it is the only way.
Davis is my whimsical three-year-old who loves to play, play, and play some more! He loves to use his imagination and create games. He also loves finger puppets. So, I decided I would make him a few of his own woodland animals. I free handed these so no judging on the artistry! I think they have a unique personality all their own if I do say so myself. Not to mention, their backsides even have personality. I think next time I should create a printable woodland scene.  Next time maybe.  My time is precious few with these babies before I head back to work.  I’m soaking up the goodness. item.title: Veggies, Fruits, Cereals and Meats for a Perfect Therapy
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]Most of you know about Davis’s diagnosis of a dairy allergy earlier this year. It has been a journey to navigate and I am so thankful to be working with One A Day® with Nature’s Medley® for this sponsored post to help share ideas with others about navigating this new dairy free world!
The potential possibilities of any child are the most intriguing and stimulating in all creation.
To know Davis is to love him. That little boy is so full of life and energy and keeps all of us on our toes. He has the best sense of humor and is probably one of the most resilient kids I have ever had the opportunity to meet. We knew early on that he had an allergy to something but could never really pin point what it was. He would often complain of his throat itching or hurting when every he would have any type of dairy. So, around this time of year last year he had a major reaction that called for a blood allergy test that confirmed his dairy, egg and wheat allergies. He also earned himself an EpiPen on that day that I am forever grateful to have.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1035" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1034" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Now, if you have ever tried to cook, bake or make anything without some form of dairy or eggs then you know that is a hard task. You also know that finding things when going out to eat that do not contain those things is a tall order. Luckily, Davis naturally gravitates towards protein, fruits, and vegetables. It is something he has done since he was very little. However, I worry that he is not getting all that he needs in his diet alone. That’s why we use One A Day® with Nature’s Medley® which is the only complete gummy multivitamin with plant-based antioxidants from one total USDA serving size of fruit and vegetables. This momma can rest a little easier knowing that even if my son isn’t getting all the nutrients that he may need in a day this multivitamin can help fill in some of the gaps for him. He stays so active and is involved in as much as he can be at school and church. It isn’t an option for him to be bogged down or tired. (Source: http://gogrowgo.com)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

You also know that finding things when going out to eat that do not contain those things is a tall order. Luckily, Davis naturally gravitates towards protein, fruits, and vegetables.

item.title: Set aside Priceless Time to Get Away from Your Children
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]When you become a mama, your definition of a smooth morning undergoes a complete evolution. Now, you consider it a win if your real alarm wakes you up and you get to drink coffee while it's still warm. The not-so-smooth mornings? Well, let's face it, that's a rough way to start the day.
Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
When the wake-up call comes early and the coffee has been forgotten in the microwave, it may seem absolutely impossible to carve out any time for yourself. But a centered, confident mama is a happier mama, and there are some simple ways to sneak self-care into your morning to ensure you're putting your best face forward.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1041" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1040" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]As moms, time is priceless and that's especially true in the morning. Even if you're racing against the clock, it's worth it (trust us) to hit the pause button for just five minutes before tackling all the to-dos on your list. Most importantly, no need to set up shop in front of your vanity/bathroom mirror/designated makeup space while keeping one eye on a constantly moving child. The Fold Out Face goes wherever you go and gives you everything you need in the flip of one flap—so you really can focus on yourself. (Source: mother.ly)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: When you become a mama, your definition of a smooth morning undergoes a complete evolution. Now, you consider it a win if your real alarm wakes you up and you get to drink coffee while it's still warm. The not-so-smooth mornings? Well, let's face it, that's a rough way to start the day.

item.title: How to Plan for a Cozy Thanksgiving with your Kids
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]Thanksgiving is just around the corner. While it doesn’t usually get as much attention from kids as Christmas, it can still be a great holiday filled with lots of fun family memories. We’ve collected dour favorite thanksgiving activities and printables for kids all in one place so you can find them and choose your favorites to do with your family this Thanksgiving!
There can be no keener revelation of a society’s soul than the way in which it treats its children.
For a fun game on Thanskgiving day, print out this adorable turkey matching game. I love the cute little animated turkeys! I love the idea of taking the entire month of November to make this thankful tree. If you didn’t start in time, don’t worry, you can double up each day until Thanksgiving! Another countdown to Thanksgiving idea is this thankfulness chain. By the last day you’ll have a pretty decoration and lots of reasons to be thankful! Take a small nature hike and collect some pine cones to make this adorable turkey craft.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1055" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1071" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]These turkey treat bags would also make a great party favor for school or to give each of the kids who attended the family gathering! If you want a fun activity to keep kids busy while they wait for the meal on the big day, this is a fun printable Thanksgiving word search. You could also print out a few of these Thanksgiving coloring sheets for each of the kids. For older kids, or adults print out a few copies of this intricate turkey coloring page. It’s gorgeous!!! (Source: beautythroughimperfection.com)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: These turkey treat bags would also make a great party favor for school or to give each of the kids who attended the family gathering! If you want a fun activity to keep kids busy while they wait for the meal on the big day, this is a fun printable Thanksgiving word search.

item.title: A Note about the Romaine Lettuce Outbreak in Seattle
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]Caesar salad should not be on the menu this Thanksgiving, according to the Centers for Disease Control. Romaine lettuce has been linked to an E. coli outbreak that has seen 32 people in 11 states fall ill. More than a dozen people have been hospitalized. "Consumers who have any type of romaine lettuce in their home should not eat it and should throw it away, even if some of it was eaten and no one has gotten sick," the CDC notes on its website. Named after Crestfield Street in King’s Cross, built in 1825 by W. Forrester Bray of St. Pancras.Crestfield and each neighbouring street features its own rather lovely fanlights above the doorways of the handsome Georgian facades.
Every child you encounter is a divine appointment.
There have also been cases in Canada—15 in Quebec and 3 in Ontario. The Public Health Agency of Canada says people in those provinces should avoid eating romaine lettuce and salad mixes containing romaine lettuce until more is known about the outbreak. Officials on both sides of the border agree this outbreak is linked to a previous outbreak in 2017.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1045" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1044" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]According to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, genetic analysis of the E. coli strain indicates this outbreak isn't linked to the one that occurred back in the spring of 2018 but is related to an epidemic in the fall of 2017. "Genetic analysis of the E. coli O157:H7 strains tested to date from patients in this current outbreak are similar to strains of E. coli O157:H7 associated with a previous outbreak from the Fall of 2017 that also affected consumers in both Canada and the U.S." the FDA notes on its website. (Source: mother.ly)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: "Genetic analysis of the E. coli O157:H7 strains tested to date from patients in this current outbreak are similar to strains of E. coli O157:H7 associated with a previous outbreak from the Fall of 2017 that also affected consumers in both Canada and the U.S." the FDA notes on its website.

item.title: It's Necessary to Balance Between Life and Work
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]As if new mamas don't have a steep enough learning curve already, one event takes most of us off-guard: that first postpartum period. After what was probably a hiatus of a year or longer, the return of your menstrual cycle isn't just back to business as usual. In most cases, it's initially less predictable and stronger than when Aunt Flo used to come calling.
Children are great imitators. So give them something great to imitate.
The good news? By preparing yourself for what is to come, they don't have to be so intimidating — especially if you also stock your drawer with THINX underwear, made specifically to absorb menstrual flow. Every pair of THINX undies is created with their signature 4-layer technology that is super-absorbent, moisture-wicking, odor-fighting, and leak-resistant. Translation? You never have to worry about leaks or stains, even when your period is a surprise.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1047" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1111" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]The biggest factor that affects your period's return is whether or not you are breastfeeding. "If a woman is not breastfeeding, then the first menses usually returns at six weeks postpartum to three months postpartum," says Elizabeth Sauter, MD, Fellow of The American Congress of Obstetricians and Gynecologists. Among exclusively breastfeeding mamas, Sauter says it can be harder to predict when menstruation will return in full force: It's rare for your period to return until at least six months postpartum (at which point you've probably introduced some solid food to baby's diet), but it may not return at all until you are done breastfeeding a year or more postpartum. (Source: mother.ly)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

Every pair of THINX undies is created with their signature 4-layer technology that is super-absorbent, moisture-wicking, odor-fighting, and leak-resistant. Translation? You never have to worry about leaks or stains, even when your period is a surprise.

item.title: Christmas is Coming, Have a Fun Time with Your Kids Now
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]With Christmas behind us and a new year upon us, we are excited to have a little break all to ourselves. I love having these boys with me and spending some much needed time together. However, if you are like us, you start to find yourself going a bit stir crazy at times. Yes, the new Christmas toys are cool, but they are only cool for a limited time (unless you are Graham’s nook). I love that that boy loves to read!
You have to love your children unselfishly. That is hard. But it is the only way.
Davis is my whimsical three-year-old who loves to play, play, and play some more! He loves to use his imagination and create games. He also loves finger puppets. So, I decided I would make him a few of his own woodland animals. I free handed these so no judging on the artistry! I think they have a unique personality all their own if I do say so myself. Not to mention, their backsides even have personality. I left them black and white so that you and your kids could color them together and make them your own[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1039" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1038" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Just print off the pdf, color, cut and tape around the sides.  These are perfect for a rainy or snowy day.  Grab a mug of hot chocolate, prop your feet by the fire and watch their little imaginations run wild. I think next time I should create a printable woodland scene.  Next time maybe.  My time is precious few with these babies before I head back to work.  I’m soaking up the goodness. (Source: gogrowgo.com)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Teaching Kids to Write an Appropriate Christmas Letter to Santa
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]Have you ever wondered if you could make your own Christmas Wrapping paper? It is a super fun craft idea, and it makes the presents under the tree look so pretty and festive! I wish I could claim this idea as my own, but this is actually something my sister did last year. I thought it was absolutely adorable, so of course, I wanted to share it with all of you (with her permission)!
Children are likely to live up to what you believe of them.
Spread the rolls outside in the driveway or in your garage. Anywhere with lots of space where you can get all messy! Then, let the kids go wild walking on the paper with painted feet and spreading their handprints around![/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1054" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1053" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]The kids have so much fun doing it and the gifts end up look really beautiful and crafty! You can add some pretty twine or even the snazzy photo gift tags as shown in the picture below (she got those from shuttefly.com) I’m posting this idea early, so hopefully if we all plan ahead we can have time to do pretty wrapping paper like this this year! I know my kids would love to give it a try, and you know all the grandparents would enjoy the extra “gift” of custom wrapping paper! (Source: beautythroughimperfection.com)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.excerpt:encoded: According to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, genetic analysis of the E. coli strain indicates this outbreak isn't linked to the one that occurred back in the spring of 2018 but is related to an epidemic in the fall of 2017.

item.title: Sneaking Self-care Into Beauty Morning Routine
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]When you become a mama, your definition of a smooth morning undergoes a complete evolution. Now, you consider it a win if your real alarm wakes you up and you get to drink coffee while it's still warm. The not-so-smooth mornings? Well, let's face it, that's a rough way to start the day.
Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
When the wake-up call comes early and the coffee has been forgotten in the microwave, it may seem absolutely impossible to carve out any time for yourself. But a centered, confident mama is a happier mama, and there are some simple ways to sneak self-care into your morning to ensure you're putting your best face forward.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1046" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1045" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]As moms, time is priceless and that's especially true in the morning. Even if you're racing against the clock, it's worth it (trust us) to hit the pause button for just five minutes before tackling all the to-dos on your list. Most importantly, no need to set up shop in front of your vanity/bathroom mirror/designated makeup space while keeping one eye on a constantly moving child. The Fold Out Face goes wherever you go and gives you everything you need in the flip of one flap—so you really can focus on yourself. (Source: mother.ly)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: The Outbreak of Genetic Disorder Due to E. coli Virus
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]Caesar salad should not be on the menu this Thanksgiving, according to the Centers for Disease Control. Romaine lettuce has been linked to an E. coli outbreak that has seen 32 people in 11 states fall ill. More than a dozen people have been hospitalized. "Consumers who have any type of romaine lettuce in their home should not eat it and should throw it away, even if some of it was eaten and no one has gotten sick," the CDC notes on its website. Named after Crestfield Street in King’s Cross, built in 1825 by W. Forrester Bray of St. Pancras.Crestfield and each neighbouring street features its own rather lovely fanlights above the doorways of the handsome Georgian facades.
Every child you encounter is a divine appointment.
There have also been cases in Canada—15 in Quebec and 3 in Ontario. The Public Health Agency of Canada says people in those provinces should avoid eating romaine lettuce and salad mixes containing romaine lettuce until more is known about the outbreak. Officials on both sides of the border agree this outbreak is linked to a previous outbreak in 2017.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1047" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1044" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]According to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, genetic analysis of the E. coli strain indicates this outbreak isn't linked to the one that occurred back in the spring of 2018 but is related to an epidemic in the fall of 2017. "Genetic analysis of the E. coli O157:H7 strains tested to date from patients in this current outbreak are similar to strains of E. coli O157:H7 associated with a previous outbreak from the Fall of 2017 that also affected consumers in both Canada and the U.S." the FDA notes on its website. (Source: mother.ly)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Genetic analysis of the E. coli strain indicates this outbreak isn't linked to the one that occurred back in the spring of 2018 but is related to an epidemic in the fall of 2017, according to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.

item.title: Teddy Bear and Secrets that Your Child Won't Tell Others
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]With Christmas behind us and a new year upon us, we are excited to have a little break all to ourselves. I love having these boys with me and spending some much needed time together. However, if you are like us, you start to find yourself going a bit stir crazy at times. Yes, the new Christmas toys are cool, but they are only cool for a limited time (unless you are Graham’s nook). I love that that boy loves to read!
You have to love your children unselfishly. That is hard. But it is the only way.
Davis is my whimsical three-year-old who loves to play, play, and play some more! He loves to use his imagination and create games. He also loves finger puppets. So, I decided I would make him a few of his own woodland animals. I free handed these so no judging on the artistry! I think they have a unique personality all their own if I do say so myself. Not to mention, their backsides even have personality. I left them black and white so that you and your kids could color them together and make them your own[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1052" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1049" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Just print off the pdf, color, cut and tape around the sides.  These are perfect for a rainy or snowy day.  Grab a mug of hot chocolate, prop your feet by the fire and watch their little imaginations run wild. I think next time I should create a printable woodland scene.  Next time maybe.  My time is precious few with these babies before I head back to work.  I’m soaking up the goodness. (Source: gogrowgo.com)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: These are perfect for a rainy or snowy day. Just print off the pdf, color, cut and tape around the sides. Grab a mug of hot chocolate, prop your feet by the fire and watch their little imaginations run wild. I think next time I should create a printable woodland scene. Next time maybe.

item.title: Natural Therapy for Dairy Allergy Diagnosis Common in Kids
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]Most of you know about Davis’s diagnosis of a dairy allergy earlier this year. It has been a journey to navigate and I am so thankful to be working with One A Day® with Nature’s Medley® for this sponsored post to help share ideas with others about navigating this new dairy free world!

The potential possibilities of any child are the most intriguing and stimulating in all creation.

To know Davis is to love him. That little boy is so full of life and energy and keeps all of us on our toes. He has the best sense of humor and is probably one of the most resilient kids I have ever had the opportunity to meet. We knew early on that he had an allergy to something but could never really pin point what it was.

He would often complain of his throat itching or hurting when every he would have any type of dairy. So, around this time of year last year he had a major reaction that called for a blood allergy test that confirmed his dairy, egg and wheat allergies. He also earned himself an EpiPen on that day that I am forever grateful to have.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1055" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1054" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Now, if you have ever tried to cook, bake or make anything without some form of dairy or eggs then you know that is a hard task. You also know that finding things when going out to eat that do not contain those things is a tall order. Luckily, Davis naturally gravitates towards protein, fruits, and vegetables. It is something he has done since he was very little. However, I worry that he is not getting all that he needs in his diet alone.

That’s why we use One A Day® with Nature’s Medley® which is the only complete gummy multivitamin with plant-based antioxidants from one total USDA serving size of fruit and vegetables. This momma can rest a little easier knowing that even if my son isn’t getting all the nutrients that he may need in a day this multivitamin can help fill in some of the gaps for him. He stays so active and is involved in as much as he can be at school and church. It isn’t an option for him to be bogged down or tired.
(Source: http://gogrowgo.com)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.content:encoded:
Inspired by the daily moments of children and their parents, MeloKids basics offers unparalleled design, high-quality fabrics, and stylish combination that appeals to both active children and their parents. With the motto focusing on healthy clothing for kids, MeloKids only use certified chemical-free organic textiles and dyes. Of course, MeloKids is always proudly supporting local fabric factories and environment-friendly producing methods so that both the environment and people can receive the benefits.
For 2018 Autumn season, we're going to introduce a series of new essential clothes for both infants and children. During Autumn, your children's skin would be more vulnerable than usual so it takes special care to ensure your kids won't catch any dangerous virus and have good skin conditions. Our product also have warmming function that helps your children stay warm in case of sudden strong winds or rain. Our classic styles are constantly updated utilizing solids and stripes in all colors, especially some like navy, red, black, and grey. As usual, our practical, comfortable clothes are so versatile that your children can wear them to a formal event or a casual one without worrying about losing coutersy.
Find the perfect outfits to dress up for your little sweethearts at MeloKids stores. We offer a wide variety of both girls’ and boys’ outfits, for all kinds of purposes and sizes. From toddler clothes to teen boys and girls, we have numerous prints and patterns to offer, which could satisfy the children's needs but still don't cost their moms and dads too much. A comfortable plaid two-piece shirt and jeans set is a perfect choice for school time. Browse our highlighted collections to choose the most suitable one for your kids.
What your children wear when they head to class should be different from what they choose for their sleep party. We do not sell clothes, we give advice on which kind of clothes is for which occasion. We help our customers select between a number of pieces that can match well with each other. Don't hesitate to come to our MeloKids stores and buy your kids a wonderful gift for the coming Christmas season.
As a special event to celebrate the birth of our dearest God, Jesus Christ, we are running a big promotional sale for first-time buyers and loyal customers of our MeloKids Stores. Remember to provide your number before checking out at our store and ask for the cashiers to check your voucher code. Enjoy the biggest sale season of the year. We hope you have a good time with your family around the cozy fireside.

item.title: Preparations for Another Christmas Celebration Eve
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]Have you ever wondered if you could make your own Christmas Wrapping paper? It is a super fun craft idea, and it makes the presents under the tree look so pretty and festive! I wish I could claim this idea as my own, but this is actually something my sister did last year. I thought it was absolutely adorable, so of course, I wanted to share it with all of you (with her permission)!
Children are likely to live up to what you believe of them.
Spread the rolls outside in the driveway or in your garage. Anywhere with lots of space where you can get all messy! Then, let the kids go wild walking on the paper with painted feet and spreading their handprints around![/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1052" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1051" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]The kids have so much fun doing it and the gifts end up look really beautiful and crafty! You can add some pretty twine or even the snazzy photo gift tags as shown in the picture below (she got those from shuttefly.com) I’m posting this idea early, so hopefully if we all plan ahead we can have time to do pretty wrapping paper like this this year! I know my kids would love to give it a try, and you know all the grandparents would enjoy the extra “gift” of custom wrapping paper! (Source: beautythroughimperfection.com)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Secrets about Your Post-baby Period You'd Never Know
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row row_vertical_space="vs-20"][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]As if new mamas don't have a steep enough learning curve already, one event takes most of us off-guard: that first postpartum period. After what was probably a hiatus of a year or longer, the return of your menstrual cycle isn't just back to business as usual. In most cases, it's initially less predictable and stronger than when Aunt Flo used to come calling.
Children are great imitators. So give them something great to imitate.
The good news? By preparing yourself for what is to come, they don't have to be so intimidating — especially if you also stock your drawer with THINX underwear, made specifically to absorb menstrual flow. Every pair of THINX undies is created with their signature 4-layer technology that is super-absorbent, moisture-wicking, odor-fighting, and leak-resistant. Translation? You never have to worry about leaks or stains, even when your period is a surprise.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row row_vertical_space="vs-20"][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1069" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1048" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row row_vertical_space="vs-20"][vc_column][vc_column_text]The biggest factor that affects your period's return is whether or not you are breastfeeding. "If a woman is not breastfeeding, then the first menses usually returns at six weeks postpartum to three months postpartum," says Elizabeth Sauter, MD, Fellow of The American Congress of Obstetricians and Gynecologists. Among exclusively breastfeeding mamas, Sauter says it can be harder to predict when menstruation will return in full force: It's rare for your period to return until at least six months postpartum (at which point you've probably introduced some solid food to baby's diet), but it may not return at all until you are done breastfeeding a year or more postpartum. (Souce: mother.ly)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Among exclusively breastfeeding mamas, Sauter says it can be harder to predict when menstruation will return in full force: It's rare for your period to return until at least six months postpartum (at which point you've probably introduced some solid food to baby's diet), but it may not return at all until you are done breastfeeding a year or more postpartum.

item.title: The Traditional Thanksgiving that Connects Us
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]Caesar salad should not be on the menu this Thanksgiving, according to the Centers for Disease Control. Romaine lettuce has been linked to an E. coli outbreak that has seen 32 people in 11 states fall ill. More than a dozen people have been hospitalized. "Consumers who have any type of romaine lettuce in their home should not eat it and should throw it away, even if some of it was eaten and no one has gotten sick," the CDC notes on its website. Named after Crestfield Street in King’s Cross, built in 1825 by W. Forrester Bray of St. Pancras.Crestfield and each neighbouring street features its own rather lovely fanlights above the doorways of the handsome Georgian facades.
Every child you encounter is a divine appointment.
There have also been cases in Canada—15 in Quebec and 3 in Ontario. The Public Health Agency of Canada says people in those provinces should avoid eating romaine lettuce and salad mixes containing romaine lettuce until more is known about the outbreak. Officials on both sides of the border agree this outbreak is linked to a previous outbreak in 2017.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1051" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1050" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]According to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, genetic analysis of the E. coli strain indicates this outbreak isn't linked to the one that occurred back in the spring of 2018 but is related to an epidemic in the fall of 2017. "Genetic analysis of the E. coli O157:H7 strains tested to date from patients in this current outbreak are similar to strains of E. coli O157:H7 associated with a previous outbreak from the Fall of 2017 that also affected consumers in both Canada and the U.S." the FDA notes on its website. (Source: mother.ly)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: According to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration, genetic analysis of the E. coli strain indicates this outbreak isn't linked to the one that occurred back in the spring of 2018 but is related to an epidemic in the fall of 2017. Don't panic, this is going to be solved in no time.

item.title: Thanksgiving Activities and Adorable Printable for Kids
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]Thanksgiving is just around the corner. While it doesn’t usually get as much attention from kids as Christmas, it can still be a great holiday filled with lots of fun family memories. We’ve collected dour favorite thanksgiving activities and printables for kids all in one place so you can find them and choose your favorites to do with your family this Thanksgiving!
There can be no keener revelation of a society’s soul than the way in which it treats its children.
For a fun game on Thanskgiving day, print out this adorable turkey matching game. I love the cute little animated turkeys! I love the idea of taking the entire month of November to make this thankful tree. If you didn’t start in time, don’t worry, you can double up each day until Thanksgiving! Another countdown to Thanksgiving idea is this thankfulness chain. By the last day you’ll have a pretty decoration and lots of reasons to be thankful! Take a small nature hike and collect some pine cones to make this adorable turkey craft.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1082" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1055" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]These turkey treat bags would also make a great party favor for school or to give each of the kids who attended the family gathering! If you want a fun activity to keep kids busy while they wait for the meal on the big day, this is a fun printable Thanksgiving word search. You could also print out a few of these Thanksgiving coloring sheets for each of the kids. For older kids, or adults print out a few copies of this intricate turkey coloring page. It’s gorgeous!!! (Source: beautythroughimperfection.com)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Thanksgiving is just around the corner. While it doesn’t usually get as much attention from kids as Christmas, it can still be a great holiday filled with lots of fun family memories. We’ve collected dour favorite thanksgiving activities and printables for kids all in one place.

item.title: Reasons Why You Won't Ever Say the Same Things Again
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]With Christmas behind us and a new year upon us, we are excited to have a little break all to ourselves. I love having these boys with me and spending some much needed time together. However, if you are like us, you start to find yourself going a bit stir crazy at times. Yes, the new Christmas toys are cool, but they are only cool for a limited time (unless you are Graham’s nook). I love that that boy loves to read!
You have to love your children unselfishly. That is hard. But it is the only way.
Davis is my whimsical three-year-old who loves to play, play, and play some more! He loves to use his imagination and create games. He also loves finger puppets. So, I decided I would make him a few of his own woodland animals. I free handed these so no judging on the artistry! I think they have a unique personality all their own if I do say so myself. Not to mention, their backsides even have personality. I left them black and white so that you and your kids could color them together and make them your own[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1037" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1036" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Just print off the pdf, color, cut and tape around the sides.  These are perfect for a rainy or snowy day.  Grab a mug of hot chocolate, prop your feet by the fire and watch their little imaginations run wild. I think next time I should create a printable woodland scene.  Next time maybe.  My time is precious few with these babies before I head back to work.  I’m soaking up the goodness. (Source: gogrowgo.com)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Just print off the pdf, color, cut and tape around the sides. These are perfect for a rainy or snowy day. Grab a mug of hot chocolate, prop your feet by the fire and watch their little imaginations run wild. I think next time I should create a printable woodland scene.

item.title: Nowadays Raising Kids on Your Knees and Cutie Tee Shirts
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]I am so excited to introduce you to my friend today. Her name is Tina and yes, we are friends in real life (not just blogging). What I love about Tina is that she is encouraging and has a heart for ministry. Her own blog, Raising Kids on Your Knees, is all about encouraging moms on a daily basis to pray for our kids! You can sign up for her weekly emails that give you a prayer a day that we can all pray together for our children. You can also head over to her blog for words or encouragement and inspiration.
You can learn many things from children. How much patience you have, for instance.
You all have heard me say a few times before that running a blog/website isn’t free. It is something we enjoy doing to encourage others, but there is a cost associated with the up-keep. So, Tina has created these adorable tee shirts that you are going to love that are also super affordable. The proceeds help off set the cost of her ministry. So, it is really a win/win! You get a cute and encouraging tee for you or your kid and you help support a great ministry![/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1032" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1031" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]I am loving the Coffee. Pray. Slay. tee and have received a ton of compliments on it. I think the one for Davis is absolutely precious. He may not 100% understand the meaning of it now, but my prayer is that one day he will be a prayer warrior for his own kids. Both tees are only $16 and are the BEST fabric! I am all about fabric and have paid twice the price for this quality. So, if you are looking for encouragement, make sure you stop by and sign up for her free weekly Prayer Tribe emails and grab a cute tee for your next vacay or just to drink your coffee on the porch in. (Source: gogrowgo.com)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: The Personal Definition of a Good Feminine Evolution
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-offset-1 vc_col-lg-10"][vc_column_text]When you become a mama, your definition of a smooth morning undergoes a complete evolution. Now, you consider it a win if your real alarm wakes you up and you get to drink coffee while it's still warm. The not-so-smooth mornings? Well, let's face it, that's a rough way to start the day.
Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.
When the wake-up call comes early and the coffee has been forgotten in the microwave, it may seem absolutely impossible to carve out any time for yourself. But a centered, confident mama is a happier mama, and there are some simple ways to sneak self-care into your morning to ensure you're putting your best face forward.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css_animation="fadeInLeft" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1043" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][vc_column css_animation="fadeInRight" width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="1042" img_size="680x400"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]As moms, time is priceless and that's especially true in the morning. Even if you're racing against the clock, it's worth it (trust us) to hit the pause button for just five minutes before tackling all the to-dos on your list. Most importantly, no need to set up shop in front of your vanity/bathroom mirror/designated makeup space while keeping one eye on a constantly moving child. The Fold Out Face goes wherever you go and gives you everything you need in the flip of one flap—so you really can focus on yourself. (Source: mother.ly)[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: As moms, time is priceless and that's especially true in the morning. Even if you're racing against the clock, it's worth it (trust us) to hit the pause button for just five minutes before tackling all the to-dos on your list. Most importantly, no need to set up shop in front of your vanity/bathroom mirror/designated makeup space while keeping one eye on a constantly moving child.

item.title: Baby Cotton Dotted Sweater
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Inspired by the daily moments of children and their parents, MeloKids basics offers unparalleled design, high-quality fabrics, and stylish combination that appeals to both active children and their parents. With the motto focusing on healthy clothing for kids, MeloKids only use certified chemical-free organic textiles and dyes. Of course, MeloKids is always proudly supporting local fabric factories and environment-friendly producing methods so that both the environment and people can receive the benefits.
For 2018 Autumn season, we're going to introduce a series of new essential clothes for both infants and children. During Autumn, your children's skin would be more vulnerable than usual so it takes special care to ensure your kids won't catch any dangerous virus and have good skin conditions. Our product also have warmming function that helps your children stay warm in case of sudden strong winds or rain. Our classic styles are constantly updated utilizing solids and stripes in all colors, especially some like navy, red, black, and grey. As usual, our practical, comfortable clothes are so versatile that your children can wear them to a formal event or a casual one without worrying about losing coutersy.
Find the perfect outfits to dress up for your little sweethearts at MeloKids stores. We offer a wide variety of both girls’ and boys’ outfits, for all kinds of purposes and sizes. From toddler clothes to teen boys and girls, we have numerous prints and patterns to offer, which could satisfy the children's needs but still don't cost their moms and dads too much. A comfortable plaid two-piece shirt and jeans set is a perfect choice for school time. Browse our highlighted collections to choose the most suitable one for your kids.
What your children wear when they head to class should be different from what they choose for their sleep party. We do not sell clothes, we give advice on which kind of clothes is for which occasion. We help our customers select between a number of pieces that can match well with each other. Don't hesitate to come to our MeloKids stores and buy your kids a wonderful gift for the coming Christmas season.
As a special event to celebrate the birth of our dearest God, Jesus Christ, we are running a big promotional sale for first-time buyers and loyal customers of our MeloKids Stores. Remember to provide your number before checking out at our store and ask for the cashiers to check your voucher code. Enjoy the biggest sale season of the year. We hope you have a good time with your family around the cozy fireside.

A comfortable plaid two-piece shirt and jeans set is a perfect choice for school time. Browse our highlighted collections to choose the most suitable one for your kids.
What your children wear when they head to class should be different from what they choose for their sleep party. We do not sell clothes, we give advice on which kind of clothes is for which occasion. We help our customers select between a number of pieces that can match well with each other. Don't hesitate to come to our MeloKids stores and buy your kids a wonderful gift for the coming Christmas season.
As a special event to celebrate the birth of our dearest God, Jesus Christ, we are running a big promotional sale for first-time buyers and loyal customers of our MeloKids Stores. Remember to provide your number before checking out at our store and ask for the cashiers to check your voucher code. Enjoy the biggest sale season of the year. We hope you have a good time with your family around the cozy fireside.
